OAR.Name: anteriorsegment
OAR.Naming: Ant Segment = Segment antérieur de l'oeil
OAR.RisqueComplications:
Risque de cataracte à 5 ans :
5 % : Dmax = 10Gy
18% :Dmax = 14Gy
50%:Dmax = 18Gy
70% :10 Gy en 1 fraction
100%: Dmax = 20-40Gy
OAR.Comment: The anterior segment of the eyeball consists of the structures ventral from the vitreous humor, including the cornea, iris, ciliary body, and lens.

OAR.Name: posteriorsegment
OAR.Naming: Post Segment = Segment postérieur de l'oeil
OAR.RisqueComplications:
Risque de cécité à 5 ans:
5 % : Dmoyenne = 45Gy
50% : Dmoyenne = 65Gy
Risque de rétinopathie à 5ans:
0 % : Dmoyenne < 40-45Gy
Risque de rétinopathie à 5 ans :
0 % : Dmoyenne < 40-45Gy
50% : Dmoyenne = 45-55Gy
83% : Dmoyenne = 55-65Gy
100% : Dmoyenne > 65Gy
OAR.ContraintesPlanification:
Oeil-rétine :
Dmoyenne inf 45 Gy
OEil total :
V30 Gy < 50% V50 Gy < 30%
OAR.Comment: The posterior segment of the eyeball is located posteriorly to the lens, and consists of the anterior hyaloid membrane and all of the posterior optical structures including the vitreous humor, retina, and choroid. The optic nerve is excluded.

OAR.Name: Brain
OAR.RisqueComplications:
Risque de complications à 5 ans de 5 % :
V60 Gy = 33%
OAR.Comment: The delineation of the brain includes brain vessels, and excludes the brainstem.

OAR.Name: BrainStem
OAR.Caudal: Tip of the dens of C2
OAR.Comment: MRI is recommended for delineation of the brainstem.

OAR.Name: Lacrimal gland
OAR.Comment: None

OAR.Name: Chiasm
OAR.Cranial: 1 cm superior to the pituitary gland
OAR.Comment: MRI is recommended for delineation.

OAR.Name: Optic Nerve
OAR.RisqueComplications:
Risque de cécité à 5 ans :
0-5% : Dmax = 50-60Gy 50% : Dmax = 65Gy Risque de 5 % de neuropathie à 10 ans
si Dmax > 60Gy
Risque de névrite inhabituel à 5 ans
3-7%:Dmax = 55-60Gy 7-20%:Dmax sup 60Gy
OAR.Comment: It has to be contoured all the way from the posterior edge of the eyeball, through the bony optic canal to the optic chiasm. MRI is recommended for a better delineation of the optic nerve

OAR.Name: Pituitary Gland
OAR.Comment: The inner part of the sella turcica can be used as surrogate anatomical bony structure.

OAR.Name: Carotid
OAR.Cranial: Lower part of the optic chiasm.
OAR.Comment: The carotid arteries include the common and internal carotid artery

OAR.Name: Cochlea
OAR.ContraintesPlanification:
Dmoyenne < 40-45 Gy
Si conservation audition primordiale :
Dmoyenne < 35 Gy
OAR.Comment: The cochlea is embedded in the temporal bone, located lateral to the internal auditory meatus, which can best be recognized in CT bone view settings

OAR.Name: Mandible
OAR.RisqueComplications:
tRisque de radionécrose de 5% à 5 ans si :
patient édenté: Dmoyenne > 60 à 65Gy Patient non édenté :Dmoyenne > 60Gy
OAR.Comment: The mandible was defined as the entire mandible bone, without teeth.

OAR.Name: Parotid
OAR.Medial: Post. belly digastric m., styloid process, parapharyngeal space
OAR.Anterior: Masseter m., post. border mandibular bone, med. and lat. pterygoid m.
OAR.Posterior: Ant. belly sternocleidomastoid m., lat. side post. belly of the digastric m. (posteriormedial
OAR.Comment: Include carotid artery, retromandibular vein and extracranial facial nerve

OAR.Name: Extended oral cavity
OAR.Cranial: Hard palate mucosa and mucosal reflections near the maxilla
OAR.Caudal: The base of tongue mucosa and hyoid posteriorly and the mylohyoid m. and ant. belly of the digastric m. anteriorly
OAR.Lateral: Inner surface of the mandible and maxilla
OAR.Anterior: Inner surface of the mandible and maxilla
OAR.Posterior: Post. borders of soft palate, uvula, and more inferiorly the base of tongue
OAR.Comment: None

OAR.Name: Submandibular Gland
OAR.Medial: Lat. surface mylohyoid m.,hyoglossus m., superior and middle pharyngeal constrictor m., anterior belly of the digastric m.
OAR.Lateral: Med. surface med.pterygoid m., med.surface mandibular bone, platysma
OAR.Anterior: Lat. Surface mylohyoid m., hyoglossus m.
OAR.Comment: Posterior to mandible and maxilla, no inner surface of the lips

OAR.Name: Pharyngeal Constrictor muscles
OAR.Naming: Pharyngeal Constrictor muscles = muscles constricteurs du pharynx
OAR.Lateral: Superior: medial pterygoid muscle. Middle: greater horn of hyoid bone. Inferior: superior horn of thyroid cartilage
OAR.Anterior: Superior: hamulus of pterygoid plate; mandibula; base of tongue; pharyngeal lumen. Middle: base of tongue; hyoid. Inferior: soft tissue of supraglottic/glottic larynx
OAR.Comment: Thickness ~3 mm

OAR.Name: Cricopharyngeal inlet
OAR.Caudal: 1 cm caudal to the lower edge of the cricoid cartilage
OAR.Comment: The crico-pharyngeal inlet represents the transition from the PCM to the cervical esophagus

OAR.Name: Cervical esophagus
OAR.Cranial: 1 cm caudal to the lower edge of the cricoid cartilage
OAR.RisqueComplications: Risque oesophagite sévère si V60 Gy > 30 %
OAR.Comment: None

OAR.Name: Lips
OAR.Cranial: Hard palate (lateral), anterior nasal spine (at the midline)
OAR.Caudal: Lower edge teeth sockets, cranial edge mandibular body
OAR.Lateral: Depressor anguli oris m., buccinator m., levator anguli oris m./risorius m. Buccinator
OAR.Comment: None

OAR.Name: Buccal Mucosa
OAR.Medial: Outer surface of the mandible and maxilla, oral cavity/base of tongue/soft pallate
OAR.Comment: Van de Water, Radiother. Oncol., 2009

OAR.Name: Supra Glottic Larynx
OAR.Anterior: Hyoid bone, pre-epiglottic space, thyroid cartilage
OAR.Comment: Christianen et al. [

OAR.Name: Glotticlarynx
OAR.Caudal: Caudal edge of ant. part of thyroid cartilage
OAR.RisqueComplications:
Risque de dysfonction vocale pour des doses supérieures à 60-65Gy
Risque d'oedème laryngé pour des doses supérieures à 45Gy
OAR.Comment: Includes thevocal cords and paraglottic fat.

OAR.Name: Thyroid
OAR.Comment: The thyroid gland has two connected lobes and is located below the thyroid cartilage. It has considerable contrast compared to its surrounding tissues.

OAR.Name: Arytenoid
OAR.Comment: NA

OAR.Name: Spinal Cord
OAR.Cranial: Tip of the dens of C2
OAR.RisqueComplications:
;Risque de myélite radique :
Dmax = 50-50,4Gy Si association avec la chimiothérapie :
Dmax = 40-45Gy
OAR.ContraintesPlanification:
Dmax < 50 Gy
Si association chimioradiothérapie Dmax < 45 Gy
OAR.Comment: The spinal cord is delineated as the true spinal cord, not the spinal canal. Extend by at least 5 cm caudal to the PTV.

OAR.Name: Brachial Plexus
OAR.Cranial: Cranial border of C5, vertebral body
OAR.Caudal: Cranial border of T3, vertebral body
OAR.Medial: Inter vertebral foramen (bony vertebral body), lat. border of 1st rib
OAR.Lateral: Lat. border of: ant. and middle scalene m., pectoralis major, teres major
OAR.Anterior: Post. border of: anterior scalene m.,subclavian artery, axillary vein
OAR.Posterior: Ant. border ofmiddle scalene m., seratus anterior m., subscapularis m.
OAR.Comment: If the brachial plexus is wrapped around the vascular bundle on the most inferior slices, the vascular structure is included in the contour
